key_points: A 504-pound alligator, believed to have attacked 71-year-old Timothy Satterlee Sr during Hurricane Ida, was found with human remains in its stomach.
The capture ended a two-week search for Satterlee, who was last seen checking storm damage outside his Slidell, Louisiana home.
The attack occurred the day after Hurricane Ida caused devastating flooding in Louisiana.
The alligator was caught by Louisiana Department of Wildlife licensed nuisance hunters.
St. Tammany Parish Sheriff's Office announced the finding and will verify the remains with the coroner's office.
Wildlife agents spotted the alligator near the Satterlee home using a drone, leading to its capture.
Satterlee's wife witnessed the alligator attack her husband, resulting in the loss of one of his arms.
She sought help but found her husband missing upon return.
The incident has shocked the local community where Satterlee was known as a community pillar.
The alligator's size is unusual for the region, highlighting the severity of the attack.
spokespersons: Captain Lance Vitter (Spokesperson, St. Tammany Parish Sheriff's Office)
